Package anydev

Class Logger

java.lang.Object
anydev.Logger
public final class Logger extends Object
Logger: Define a log-event by its level, location, and description using a fluent Builder pattern. This class centralizes all logging in your model.
Since:
2025_06_20

  • Method Details

    • log

      public static Logger_LocationStep log(Logger.Level level)
      Log a new event of a level of your choice. This is the entry point for building a log entry.
      Parameters:
      level - The level of this log entry (i.e. how severe is this). Use Logger.Level to access all possible levels and their descriptions.

    • logINFO

      public static Logger_LocationStep logINFO()
      Log a new INFO event. Those are typically just added to the console via traceln() and should be used for trivial log events

    • logWARNING

      public static Logger_LocationStep logWARNING()
      Log a new WARNING event. Those are typically just added to the console via traceln() but should be used for non-trivial log events that users should investigate.

    • logAndThrowERROR

      public static Logger_LocationStep logAndThrowERROR()
      Log a new ERROR event and throw the associated exception for it (i.e .break the model) Those are used for severe events that cannot be ignored and make it impossible to continue to run the model

    • getLevel

      public Logger.Level getLevel()
      Returns:
      the log-level of this log-event

    • getSource

      public Optional<Object> getSource()
      Returns:
      what was defined to be the location type of this log-event. Can be an Agent or a String typically

    • getCauseDescr

      public Optional<String> getCauseDescr()
      Returns:
      what was defined to be the description of the root cause of this log-event

    • getCause

      public Optional<Logger.Cause> getCause()
      Returns:
      what was defined to be the root cause-type of this log-event

    • getSuggestedSolution

      public Optional<String> getSuggestedSolution()
      Returns:
      what was defined to be the suggested solution to fix this log-event in the future

    • getLogTime

      public Optional<Double> getLogTime()
      Returns:
      When was this log-event logged, in model time-units since model start

    • getMsg

      public Optional<String> getMsg()
      Returns:
      Additional msg text defined for this log entry. Empty if not defined.
